alert.note: Alert for Pawnee; Stafford (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 21 at 5:10AM CDT by NWS Dodge City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Pawnee and central Stafford Counties through 600 AM CDT... At 510 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Radium, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Seward around 520 AM CDT. Dillwyn around 530 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include St. John and Hudson. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 AM CDT for south central Kansas.
